title: Missing block proposal due to late inclusion
body:
I'm getting missed block proposals and I'd like to find out the reason. It used to be working fine with Prysm 4.0.5 and mev-boost 1.5.
I don't have debug logs atm but maybe someone could give me a hint what is happening betweem 12:51:47 and 12:51:50. I have a too long delay "sinceSlotStartTime=3.937088591s" which exceeded the inclusion time of 4000ms on the mev block builder site so they rejected my request. I ended up with a missing block proposal.

EL and CL are running on an NVMe disk (no i/o problems) and my internet connection was absolutely ok during this period of time.

Do you think I should reduce the max peers of the beacon-node from default to a lower value? I've looking for a solution since sunday afternoon but I have no clue what the reason could be. Any help would be much appreciated.

Log:
Jul  9 12:51:47 eth2-staking1 mev-boost[1446]: time="2023-07-09T12:51:47.346+02:00" level=info msg="http: GET /eth/v1/builder/header/6839657/0x717236ab3c866d23d2456cb0eb26ec4443655eadb8cfcd0d066988f8a0d1508a/0xa4c0aa10574634b297291afa6381b6f7988d68c1231ad7d661ddc4e3811955dd8bcb187e7ca30ab2ca293f6782340d27 200" duration=0.261881 method=GET path=/eth/v1/builder/header/6839657/0x717236ab3c866d23d2456cb0eb26ec4443655eadb8cfcd0d066988f8a0d1508a/0xa4c0aa10574634b297291afa6381b6f7988d68c1231ad7d661ddc4e3811955dd8bcb187e7ca30ab2ca293f6782340d27 status=200 version=v1.6
